intro: Obeliscaria hispidula, commonly known as the hairy rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and is native to rocky and gravelly habitats in Europe and parts of Asia. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, and its leaves are covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. Obeliscaria hispidula typically thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
